Review.Titre: SSD wasn't compatible with my MoBd
Review.Contenu: I used the crucial app to scan my computer for upgrade of SSD and chose the top of the line offered but I could not fit the SSD to my computer. I have a membership at BestBuy/GeekSquad and took it to their shop to fit and commission the new SSD but after trying for some hours it seems that the computer motherboard will not accept the faster Gen5 SSD after all.

The RAM modules I ordered (Crucial Pro DDR4 3200MT/s Memory Kit) were supposed to be compatible with my new Dell Inspiron 3020 Desktop. However, after installation the computer would not boot up. Tech support advised to remove the battery from the motherboard for 15 minutes, replace it, & boot up. My computer still would not boot up. I have had to return the modules for a refund. I obtained a Kit from another vendor which worked fine.

Review.Contenu: Order is still in process for 2 weeks.  Customer service is worst, waiting for 30 minutes to get an agent, then put on hold for another 30 minutes, and disconnected.

Review.Titre: terrible customer service and faulty website
Review.Contenu: The product was advertised to include one month of Adobe Creative Cloud access. However, due to the absence of any email confirmation from the registration process, I am unable to utilize this feature that was marketed on their website. Also, terrible customer service. When I could not register my product online due to a website error. I contacted support and despite being promised a follow-up within 1 to 2 days, I received no response. When I reached out again after two days, I was only informed that they would look into the issue and get back to me in an extended timeframe of 12 days. That will be a wait of half a month so that basic staff of customer service can figure out what went wrong about a simple email forwarding error.

Review.Titre: still hasn't shipped and no update

No Cross-Shipping OptionI have been purchasing Crucial memory and drives for many years and have always been happy. I have never needed support until now. If you plan to use Crucial memory in a device used for business purposes, think twice before purchasing memory directly from them.I purchased a 32GB Kit (2 x 16GB) on 10/6/2023 and found that one of the sticks was defective after testing and reloading several times. When I contacted support on 11/10/2023, the support representative said they do not cross-ship and would send a replacement once they received the memory and verified it was defective.Support said I could return the memory for a refund, “returned on 11/17/2023,” but that was not the case. Crucial shipped the replacement memory on 12/8/2023. I contacted support on 11/10/2023. It took Crucial Support over ten days to send the replacement memory “that I had already replaced.”Again, use caution if you use their memory for business hardware. You might have some downtime unless you have spare memory or hardware available.

Review.Titre: If you buy from them, expect less than advertised and a big hassle for returns.
Review.Contenu: I ordered two NVme SSD harddrives( add on for my Intel Inspiron and Lenovo Thinkpad.  I ordered a 1tb upgrade for each of my computers.  The advertised speed was 6000 mb give or take. Neither device came anywhere close to those speeds, maybe 1/3rd as fast as advertised.  Both machines have similar Intel I 7 8 core processors, maybe different bus speeds.  I bought directly from Crucial, Big mistake if you have to return something. One of the SSD's came with a heatsink, I did not need. Simple mistake, but after a week of discussion with the sales staff, they finally at my insistence sent an RMA.  Its in the mail now, I wonder if I will ever really get a refund. Very cumbersome process.

Review.Titre: The prices are not listed as American…
Review.Contenu: The prices are not listed as American currency until the end, resulting in what appears to be lower prices than are actually present. Expedited shipping was double the price and arrived one day sooner. I had to also pay an extra 100 dollars to have the items cross the boarder as well. An initial cost of around 320 came out to 650+ in the end. I would avoid buying crucial especially off their website. Use new egg or some other website and stick to actually well known brands such as Corsair or gskill

Placed 4 orders, each time items showed in stock then received an email stating items were out of stock a few days after I ordered. Do not order directly from them if you expect your order to arrive in less than 3 weeks.

The scanner said there were two slots for memory in a laptop. Based on that I assumed I could use both SDRAMs at once. There is only 1 slot for memory in the laptop.

I used the crucial configurator to scan my laptop and then purchased recommended memory. However, the memory I purchased is not, in fact, compatible. Worse, I installed the memory while waiting on a new battery and did not keep the packaging, so I’m not sure I can return it. So much for trusting the configurator.

I have extensive experience with computers. Your software would NOT allow me to clone my HDD, so your SSD is now sitting on my desk.  I bought another 2T drive from another company and the cloning went smoothly. Review.Titre: The worst customer service I've ever experienced, EVER!
Review.Contenu: Customer service was unable to cancel an order just 5 minutes after it was placed online. The order shipped with an invalid tracking number, and when I reported this to customer service they told me I was checking too soon and just had to wait longer. Well, I waited days and it was still invalid because they sent a UPS tracking number but shipped it by slow boat USPS. It eventually showed up, but now I have to process a return because I couldn't wait for it to show up and I ordered from another vendor. Good product, terrible customer service. Lesson learned, never order directly from Crucial, go to Amazon or some other retailer instead.

Review.Titre: What seems to be rude customer service agents and dishonest products
Review.Contenu: I was having what I thought was a pleasant experience with a Crucial agent until they just ghosted me. Stopped responding, and after reading the other 1star reviews on here I think there may be a pattern - Crucial may not want to admit to higher error rate than advertised. I will leave this review up until I get an answer and the problem resolved. Because I can only infer from what has anecdotally happened to me - my current situation is without answerAttached is the SMART data from my drive, sure its only a single Reported Uncorrectable Errors 1 ECC Correction Failures - and all I was asking what was the acceptable error rate, is this drive safe enough to store things on long term when this has occurred within the first few hours of being turned on - shipped straight from Crucial themselves.And yet no response other than "This could be possibly due to Bad Memory or CPU issue" And I responded with how is that possible as my other crucial drives do not have this issue, only this brand new drive from crucial No response. Ghosted...... Who does that?????

After reviewing Crucials response, my update is: Crucial needs to check its shipping department. I contacted the carrier and the item was not received by them for four days. It was delivered to me 10 days after I placed my order.

Review.Titre: Not delivered, no tracking, won't resend.
Review.Contenu: Ordered a lot of ram for a server, est. delivery was 3 - 4 working days. we are now well over a week after i ordered, the tracking says the label has been printed and nothing else. It has not been scanned by UPS once. I contacted Crucial last week and was told they wouldn't do anything until today. Contacted this morning and all they say it the will send to the "concern" team which may take 10 business days before they will consider resending the obviously lost order. It has been 11 days since i placed my order and not one bit of tracking has been logged by UPS. Simply not good enough.

SSD CT4000P3SSD8 (NVME 4TB) drive: be aware, this is QLC drive without DDR cache, which means that write speed is approx. 90-95MBps !!! performace is below even spinning drive with fraction of a price cost. Additionally, 4TB SSD having 800TBW is extremely low (but fare, considering technology). You'd better go with normal HDD in this case. Doesn't make a shread of sense to buy one.
Disappointed with this company. False advertising os speed of their nvme drives and software that does not even load on Windows 10. Crucial storage executive.A complete disaster

Review.Titre: Shipping was slow, terrible tech support
Review.Contenu: Shipping was slow, mail innovations is one of the slowest shipping options due to significant delays while USP transfers the package to USPS. Neither carrier will acknowledge having the package during the multi-day transfer. Tech support was useless. After exhausting all the articles and videos on Crucial's site (as well as internet searches) to determine the issue, I contacted tech support only to deal with someone who sounded like they were reading from a script or googling ideas. The end result was tech support telling me to use a third party software which did not appear to be secure and was not free. Sincerely felt that the issue was with the SSD drive, since I've cloned and replaced drives before. Returned item--at my expense. Disappointed and frustrated.

A fourth time I called, I could not understand the support tech guy, but he gave me an e-mail address to write to, which I tried. It got rejected .

MS500 SSD arrived dead, but it took 10+ hours for Crucial CS to determine this. Multiple agents could not coordinate a fix. They finally instructed me to return the SSD (at MY expense), then wait and wait for a replacement -- a return that could take 2-3 weeks total. Other companies overnight replacement parts. When Crucial parts fail, they make brand ambassadors like us wait for weeks -- and pay for shipping of THEIR faulty parts. What's more, in the troubleshooting process, the India-based CS team told me to change several BIOS settings which now have caused conflicts with my Operating System. Asking for a fix, their CS Team today told me to completely reformat my disk, meaning I will have to reload Win11 and all the OS updates and then reload and tweak dozens of software programs, just to return my computer to pre-Crucial status. We have long been Crucial brand ambassadors but Crucial CS today is terrible and their incompetence is costing me a lot of money. Shame on Crucial. My social media campaign against Crucial has just begun!

My very first order which predates this one by a couple months, was a 96GB kit (48GB x 2) ram modules for laptop, which worked perfectly fine. I ordered another 48GB single module (same everythingas the kit btw, just more expensive), and turns out it is defective. When put in my laptop, it won't turn on at all (exact behavior: IMMEDIATE POWER OFF, after power on) - My laptop is CONFIRMED WORKING AND COMPATIBLE 101% with these 48GB modules. AS I been using the 96GB kit on it.I did all sorts of troubleshooting, like trying one of the modules from my 96GB kit in that other laptop, and it works, but when trying that new 48GB in any laptop where I been using similar module (also ordered from them as I mentioned) it simply doesn't even let the laptop start, immediate power off after powering on.I can 101% assert that the module I received is indeed defective (I feel like it's shorted inside) based on how my laptop behaves when turned on.I am absolutely disappointed $184 flushed down the drain. Thanks a lot crucial for not allowing returns either.If I could rate you as 0 stars, I would.I have not been able to speak to support either.Unless you must, do not buy directly from them.

I found a another cloning/back-up software and using it was a breeze and it only took 2.14 hrs to complete the process.

Literally the worst customer service you could imagine. As others have stated, the tracking numbers provided are invalid (not found by UPS). Called in a few times and was told to continue waiting.If you do want to purchase directly from their website, I recommend using PayPal or a credit card so you can easily get your money back when Crucial inevitably fails to deliver the product.

I purchased 32GB (2 sticks of 16GB) DDR4 ram.  After install everything works but after a few minutes, the screen goes black.  After experimenting, I found that one of the sticks is unstable but the other works fine.  Crucial will not send a replacement without the faulty RAM being returned first.  This computer is running a CNC machine and I can not afford to be without production for that long.  So in the end I paid for 32GB to get only 16GB of functioning RAM.  Not a good deal.  If I sell a customer a faulty item, I feel responsible and will send a replacement and wait for the faulty item to be replaced at the customer's convenience.  Micron's warranty process needs to be changed to reflect the real world needs of the customer.

Review.Titre: I canceled order for my money refunded
Review.Contenu: I canceled order got  my money refunded  3 weeks later they decide to charge my card again  and then when you call the machine speaking’s sounds like 1990s robot I already knew I was going to have trouble of course they barely know English   Smh some fraud sh1TT I tell you
Still do not have it. Takes way to long.

I ordered memory for delivery , somehow the unit number for my home was missed.my fault completely . I could not get ahold of someone to try to rectify the address situation. Now I have to wait for a refund on an item. To repurchase and wait more time . I was hoping that the reps could've corrected the address and sent me the order . But nope its a waiting game. And it didn't help that I got emails receipts from two different company's.  So tracking down a customer service rep or anyone outside of a chat never happened.

Review.Titre: Checked the compatibility of the SSD…
Review.Contenu: Checked the compatibility of the SSD and my motherboard on the Crucial website and it verified that it would work. Once I got it and spent 2 days trying to get it to work, finally figured out that it’s not compatible and I wasted $450 on the ssd that would not work.

Review.Titre: ordered ssd on 7/5/23 was posted on…
Review.Contenu: ordered ssd on 7/5/23 was posted on 9/5/23 using royal mail 24 hour. followed the link in email to spring gds, package started in Prague CZ,followed by Pulhiem DE, followed by the Hague NL customs, then finally Middlesex customs, and still not recieved it, so much for 24 hours, i ended up buying 2 from amazon delivered the same day, god knows when crucials one will turn up, i'll never use again.
Returns are a hassle. Even after you get the return approval you may NEVER see the credit. Customer Service Reps don’t speak English and hard to understand. It’s exhausting & near Rip Off criteria!

Review.Titre: Crucial cheaps out on customer service…
Review.Contenu: Crucial cheaps out on customer service which 9x out of 10 is an indicator on their products because what else do they cheap out on.  They're one of those companies that send American jobs overseas. After struggling for days trying to mirror my windows o/s drive with endless errors I finally give up and call "tech support."  I got some guy in India (Pakistan? He was reluctant to tell me where he was but the accent was very thick.  I respect that he learned English, he seemed like a nice enough guy, but that doesn't mean he's easy to understand) that I could BARELY hear... that was working from home.  He tried to tell me he was on a landline but he was not, cell phones cutting out are unmistakable.  So a) his voice volume was painfully low, b) his accent was SO thick when the line wasn't cutting out I could understand maybe 3 of 10 words c) his line kept cutting out like he was constantly hitting the mute button randomly.  One of the few things I understood the guy say was crucial drives are not compatible with all motherboards/BIOS for mirroring.  This is how they reward their customers for giving them their business.  Sell a product that can't be mirrored, and if they need help? You get routed to Azhbadabalahad in Pakistan who is working from home.  Never again
Deliveries are painfully slow. For a company who is known for it's memory, I should not be able to get your products from second hand suppliers 500% faster.

Wrong RAMI used your website to enter in my computer and it told me which RAM was compatible. I purchased that one and it is the wrong speed and causes memory errors on my PC and does not work.  When I tried to return it I have the Email address and order number but your website "can not find my order" or account. I have sent a message to your support team but now have to wait up to 1 day for a reply.

Review.Titre: Time from payment to actual product…
Review.Contenu: Time from payment to actual product placed for delivery was ridiculous. Faster options with better support out there.  Will never shop or purchase crucial products again.  4 months later and I still have not  been given any way to return the product.
Order did not arrive, UPS tracking number does not work, very difficult to get help from the website. Glad the order was low value as it seems that I am not getting the product I ordered.

Review.Titre: I don't doubt that the quality
Review.Contenu: I don't doubt that the quality of the product itself . However, the support people do not speak English as a first language and they are almost impossible to understand. I was cut off three times. I was never able to get answers as to how I could access the Crucial to see what was copied over and access it. It became impossible and I had to return it.

Review.Titre: the guy gave me no useful info and…
Review.Contenu: the guy gave me no useful info and instruction, basically told me to "wait another day then contact us again"

I tried to initiate a return and the website was saying I was entering the wrong email and the order number I put in did not exist. I have better things to do with my time than I try to keep reentering the numbers that I know are correct because I copied them from the original email of the order confirmation.

Pre sales with raj he suggested upgrades as per my motherboard as advertised on your website, I asked if a mounting screw came with it he said no , didn’t know what screw size , spent hours to find out ,ordered it ,spent $15.00 for it only to find it was included with your m.2 drive ,countless calls to tech support to get it working , 23 hours of tinkering,finally I called tech support & get someone who wouldn’t give his name when asked   , had kids screaming in the background tells me it’s an issue that Dell & you are aware of ( then why recommend it) finally he says that tech support is going to find a solution & get back to me .they never did & I rma the product. Raj also asked it I would e/mail the general manager & put in a good word for him - a e/male is in the works to him with full details of what was just describedDid you not read what I wrote. In the many calls to tech support I got raj I mentioned the screw I had to buy since he said it wasn’t included, he asked did you get it yet , i replied no not yet , raj says we’ll send it back then . Ok I should spend another $15 ( that will make $30 total for the screw that’s included  - point being he didn’t know his product .Countless hours into trying to get your product to work & finally I get a tech support ( the one that wouldn’t identify himself , the one with his kids screaming in the background so I couldn’t even hear him as he mutes the conversation many times , tells me - there are known incompatible differences with my Dell & your product- so why recommend this to me This is customer service ?This is the way to treat a customer?

I placed an order, but I needed to cancel it shortly after. I tried to cancel it for three days before the package was shipped, but they ended up shipping the package anyway so I had to pay 15 dollar return shipping

Review.Titre: Every time I try to place an order for weeks now.
Review.Contenu: Every time I try to place an order, It fails to go through.  I have been trying since Sept. 25th.  I have a case number of 01712725.  After using the chat support and being ignored, I finally started calling.  I was told the issue would be looked at, but it wasn't elevated until the 2nd or 3rd call.  When I reminded them I'm a reseller they finally stopped telling me to buy from somebody else, and that they would actually look into the problem.  That was last week, and I still haven't heard anything back.  When I noticed the email asking me to rate my purchase experience (what purchase) just now, I tried submitting another order.  It's still failing.  As I keep saying, the first order I placed on the 25th and originally went through okay.  Later in day it was refunded for some reason.  The credit card company told me there were no issues with the account, and the order cancellation and refund wasn't necessary.  Since then, once I fill in the payment and shipping information and submit the order, it fails.  I've been able the get tax exempt approval from other parts suppliers so I have a source until this gets fixed.  I would like to buy from Crucial, but your web site won't let me.  Please let me know when this issue is fixed, or let me know if I need to fix anything I did wrong.

Review.Titre: When I discovered Crucial years ago
Review.Contenu: When I discovered Crucial years ago, I thought I had found the forever solution to my memory problems. I ordered and Crucial performed for many, many transactions. The last two times I ordered from Crucial it took for EVVVVVVVVer for me to receive the memory.  I could have reordered, driven to California to pick it up and back to the East coast, only to track down the client who was on vacation at Disney World, install the memory, and still had time to spare before the USPS, (yes, not Fedex or UPS, but the modern, stuck-in-neutral Postal "Service"), actually dropped the package in my mailbox.

Review.Titre: Ram tool from site did not work…
Review.Contenu: Ram tool from site did not work correctly ended up ordering returned it twice waiting on the second refund an update email was provided letting me know if the refund completion which was very helpful.
I got the correct parts and I am happy with that but I would have bought them somewhere else if I knew the delivery time would take weeks longer than expected.

Review.Titre: The item was too long of a wait for…
Review.Contenu: The item was too long of a wait for delivery. I thought I had purchased the item locally.
The SSD card I bought for the Inspiron 15 3501 does not work. A system shows that I need a hardrive even though my past SSD worked fine without one.

Before purchasing, I used Crucial's upgrade scanner which GUARANTEED compatibility, and could NOT install the SSD. Their software said the target drive was too small. Old drive 1TB, new drive 500GB, used space, 150 GB. Spent 4 DAYS and could not install. Spent hours online with support chat. They could not help. Said they thought it might be a software conflict on my machine. Had experienced son come over and see if he could install, and no. Contacted cust svc and asked to return, but would have to pay return shipping. It's a small thing, but I didn't feel like I should have to pay to return something they said was guaranteed compatible. So, instead of returning, and because it wasn't a lot of money in the first place, I bought an enclosure from another site and will use said drive as a backup. I will probably not buy from Crucial again because of this experience. I also was a past customer.
I placed order on 11/20/23.The ssd arrived on 12/5/23!Had I been advised of a two week delivery, I would have paid for express shipping.

Review.Titre: Bad products, no customer email support ..
Review.Contenu: No customer email support ... So we have to write our experience on this platform: We've bought 2 Crucial X6 SSDs and all of a sudden the writing speed drops to 50 MB/s after a while working with them. Blackmagicdesign's Speed Test starts at 720MB/s and then slowly drops to 50MB/s. We are very disappointed and will return the units.

Review.Titre: Browse options, don't rely on system scanner
Review.Contenu: I wanted to buy some RAM for my pc, and the scanner suggested an option. I bought it, then looked at other options just for the sake of it. There was "Pro" RAM of the same type and amount for $20 less. I couldn't cancel my order even though I had just placed it.The tracking system is also in shambles. It kept saying that there was "no package under my tracking ID". I called a representative, and she told me it would take 5 days for the tracking status to update. The status never updated.My package did eventually arrive after 8 days, but I was worried the whole time that I'd been scammed. I won't be buying from Crucial directly again.

Need to improve information for tracking shipments. If you don't ship right away, customers need to be informed of this, using a message like "Your item has shipped." Do NOT pass on a tracking number until the shipment is in the hands of the shipping company. I tried for several days to track my shipment using the tracking number that was emailed to me right after I paid. But when I entered the tracking number into the shipper's website, the response was that the tracking number was incorrect. I had to contact Crucial's customer support, who was only somewhat helpful. Only after several days when the item was actually being shipped, did the tracking number work.

Review.Titre: The price wasn't what I thought
Review.Contenu: The price wasn't what I thought. I canceled the order. I am in Canada and I didn't realize that the price was in US dollars until it was charged to my card. I  think the price should reflect where you are purchasing from.

Review.Titre: Like Dealing with a 6 Day Migraine ordering RAM & SSD
Review.Contenu: This time... Well. In bound duty to Canada was not mention nor warned about. Was not clear purchases were being made in USD but figured as much it would be. Referenced Credit Card to check. Paid for Expedited International shipping 22 USD,advised 2 days and through UPS. Package delayed on 3rd day and advised by UPS shipper had not provided any broker info. This turned into a Friday, UPS charged a further $19.45 USD to release package the following Monday. Resulted in 6 days , untold delays, extra costs and a field employee down 3 days waiting for His system to become operable again. 1st and last attempt at buying anything from Crucial .

Review.Titre: The DIMMs (RAM) don't work on ROG SCAR…
Review.Contenu: The DIMMs (RAM) don't work on ROG SCAR 16 2022.Address input wasn't great.  Loqate sucks. You didn't provide any options to add my phone number for the delivery.I couldn't find anywhere on your site, which laptops that 96gb kit is compatible with. Also lack of explanation as to why it is incompatible.

I tried getting information on the web page which was a total failure. So I called Customer Service who provided me with helpful service. Once I received the product I found it to be inferior.  I ordered a 2.5 to 3.5 SSD Bracket, which was difficult to mount.  I had to physically cut and bend the mounts to fit the Crucial 1T drive.  Then the mounts didn't easily fit into the CPU case.  Please speak with the engineers about compatibility issues.  Both these products (the SSD drive, 3.5 to 2.5 adapter) were Crucial products and should have work perfectly together.

Was disappointed with shipping. My ordered was placed the 29th of July didn't get till August 4th. My order that is only like 60 miles from Mountain Home, ID. Went from Meridian, ID to Salt Lake, then back to Mountain Home. I was given a tracking number early on I tried taking it, said the tracking number was no good. Contacted customer service they said the tracking number would show up on the 4th of August the day it was delivered, why bother giving a tracking number.

Review.Titre: Be wary about the cloning software Crucial suggests when cloning your hard drive to SSD.
Review.Contenu: Acronis True Image to clone is NOT free, to have it do a clone you need to pay $49.99 nowadays to get the tier of service necessary to do a clone. The video and link need to be updated with either an alternate free cloning software or a warning about how much it will cost. There are other options out there that are free!

Review.Titre: It took nearly a month to get one item
Review.Contenu: It took nearly a month to get one item. Contacting support wasn't an issue, but by the point I felt I needed to contact them any trust was lost. When they finally sent a shipping number it didn't work for several days. Thankfully the item arrived eventually and worked, but there was no way to cancel the order or determine where it was in the process.

Very nice website, very helpful to select the proper memory or SSD. The problem is with your shipping. It took almost a week for the memory  to be shipped and  to get a tracking number and then the tracking didn't work. Crucial ships with UPS but then the package is turned over to the USPS and disappears. Tracking dies at that point. I'll buy somewhere else in the future.

Processing and shipping needs work. I ordered and paid for 2nd day delivery. Took 10 days. I could have ordered from the Crucial store on Amazon and gotten it in 2 days for free. Prime member. Paid $8.75 for nothing. I put in a second order and it still hasn't processed or shipped. Going on 6th day now. Maybe you need more people or something?The memory I ordered is fine. Kudos for that at least. But your shipping is Luke the old pony express ...

VERY LONG DELIVERY TIME. unfortunate decision to change horses in mid-stream (UPS to USPS). Our USPS service is notorious for terrible delays, late (dark) deliveries, sometimes no mail at all for two days then lots of “lost” mail when deliveries resume, etc. repeated forecasts of mail deliveries revised up to five times and ultimately very late.

Review.Titre: I can no longer trust your so called…
Review.Contenu: I can no longer trust your so called (100% guaranteed compatible). I ordered some DDR 5 RAM and an SSD for a Dell XPS 8960, and before I even receive it, one of your engineers is telling me to return it, Huh! I thought it was 100% compatible. Anyway, I just returned both items, which I still have not received credit for. I did not open the package and I paid extra to enclose items in a box with packing peanuts around them, so they would not get damaged, much unlike your packing practices!

I was told the 4T SSD drive I ordered was in stock so ordered to replace my dead iMac drive on December 28th. Still hadn't even been shipped when I called on around the 6th or 7th. In the meantime I have no office computer and my one-person business is basically shut down. Hard to want to buy from the company ever again...

To start with, I didn't get my package. I waited a month to see if my package would ever come. When I finally called Crucial, they told me that the package got lost. And, that they would send a replacement order and ship it Priority. Well, four days later, the package shipped. And, it didn't ship priority. I called to find out why only to be met with an agent with an attitude.So, why would I become a repeat customer with this kind of treatment and attention to detail?

Review.Titre: First my order was out of stock but…
Review.Contenu: First my order was out of stock but never communicated it clearly.  Then when the item came back in stock it took a week to get it shipped out then another week to be delivered.  I’ve bought items on eBay from China that had faster shipping.  This is what I would expect from a private seller not a company like crucial.

I would have liked to select the method of delivery for my purchase.  I was told by customer service that Crucial selects the least expensive method in order to offer a discount.  According to tracking online, the item spent days sitting 30 miles from my home waiting to be delivered.  If I had chosen the shipping method, I would have paid extra to get it in far less time.

I could have bought this on Amazon with quick Prime delivery.  I thought it would be nice to cut out the middle man and help Crucial make more profit.  Little did I appreciate that my 2 day Prime delivery would be nearly 2 WEEKS from Crucial via the USPS.

Review.Titre: I ordered my product on 12\15\22 and i…
Review.Contenu: I ordered my product on 12\15\22 and i still have no delivery date as of 12\29\22. Shipping is not great. Everything else is wonderful. I love the product and the customer support. I have been using Crucial products for over 15 years. Just shipping this time is really bad. Hope this can help you with any issues. Thanks.

Review.Titre: Don't auto feed customers an answer so…
Review.Contenu: Don't auto feed customers an answer so quickly.  When wanting a refund for example or a replacement. Don't send them warranty information in which I'm certain they have looked over already! Send them the ability to print out the label you made out for them in advance. And not a well, if you want to send it back statement, than do this or that by writing the address manually and all that stuff.  Then embarrass yourself by way of saying prove who you are when clear information was given you in the first place!

ORDERED the Computer Memory on November 28th.It SHIPPED on December 1st.I RECEIVED it on December 12th from the Post Office on USPS Mail Innovations (which starts off with UPS then they hand it off to USPS)..."IT TOOK TOO LONG".They should have informed me BEFORE I purchased it that, it would take that long to arrive

Review.Titre: i placed my ordered and never received…
Review.Contenu: i placed my ordered and never received any indication that the order was received or that it was being processed or shipped.   Funds were deducted immediately from my account so i know the transaction went through.  Every time i checked the status it was showing "unconfirmed".   When i spoke with an agent or several occasions each time they said it was going to ship within 24 hours.  This happened twice.   Second time i canceled the order.  At that time, in my account, my order was still showing as unconfirmed.

Review.Titre: Unfriendly web site, when it comes to support
Review.Contenu: 1.  The tracking URL provided was incorrect.  Eventually I realized that I could dig the shipper's number out of the URL and use it on their site;  this worked.2.  At one point in the process I saw a web page that indicated that my order had been partially shipped.  Fortunately that turned out not to be the case.3.  At no time was i ever successful in using the chat feature to find out a correct URL or a delivery date.  Your chat feature fails the Turing test:  there are obviously no human beings behind it.

Review.Titre: Ordered from them 2 times 1 day apart
Review.Contenu: Ordered from them 2 times 1 day apart. Paid for express shipping for both, received 1 , waiting for the other. The first order I received was in an oversized ups bag with no protection (ram was in a plastic sleeve) Don't know what to think about the shipping process, paid 8.99 for express shipping, wow!!!!!

I received an email implying that the RAM had been delivered when it had only been shipped, if even that.  The tracking number didn't work until a few days later.  I wondered if I had gotten scammed, especially since the email was kind of wonky.  The website also didn't seem modern and paying with PayPal caused some confusing things to happen.  Using my email to get my password failed, maybe because I used PayPal, adding to my concerns about the purchase.The RAM did arrive and appears to be in good condition.

Review.Titre: Ran the test for compatible products…
Review.Contenu: Ran the test for compatible products for my lenovo ideapad. no where does it say I need to buy a cable for the sata drive. how can it be compatible if there is no way to plug it in. the memory dimm when fine as expected so far so good. If I buy your products in future will get them via amazon as free returns. I am still waiting for a prepaid label to return the sata drive that does not fit.

Delivery took extremely too long for arrival.  Still haven't received product ordered on Dec 1st and it is now Dec 12th; but the reason why I'm posting this now is because when I tried to TRACK the package on my account on the website, the order no longer is listed. Poor Customer Service.

Disappointed because on check out, there was no estimated ship or arrival date.  When I tried to check status, the UPS tracking number link threw an error.  When about a week later, I received an email shipment notification, but the UPS tracking still threw an error.  Love the products, but the web site and shipping expenses have room to improve.(

I've never had a problem with Crucial products, but their order delivery system is terrible. I still haven't received my order I placed 2 weeks ago for stock items. My advise; If you're looking for a quick turn around, pay the higher price and buy from a local retailer, or try Amazon.

No, tracking during shipment. Basically ups  just says we will let you know when it’s going to be delivered and here I am weeks later waiting on the SSD with no idea when it will ever come inThe crucial hardware i works great but , it’s crucial that I know when I’m getting it.

Review.Titre: I use the memory finder guide on the…
Review.Contenu: I use the memory finder guide on the crucial site that said this memory would work in my specific machine.  While I got the memory within the promised time - it did not work.  My thought is that since it was a faster speed than the existing memory it was to replace that is why the system did not recognize it. No option for different memory speeds were offered.  Sadly - I had to send it back for a refund. I am usually a big fan of crucial because they always get it right - but not this time.

Review.Titre: Snail Pace Delivery for simple purchase
Review.Contenu: The single memory upgrade ordered was in stock and ordered March 19 - and on arrival worked fine in the Lenovo AIO desktop just fine on install.However, it was frustrating to order this simple part and wait 11 days March 30 for its delivery in a flat mail package. It delayed the repair and I will use another vendor with to purchase even the same product such as Amazon or NewEgg.

I placed my order on 12/07/22 and finally received my order on 12/20/22.  I should have done more research on how my order was going to be shipped prior to placing the order.  Because it was shipped via UPS and then transferred to USPS, my order was temporarily lost.

The order has not arrived.  It was placed on 11/29 and today is 12/15..  I was just told by customer support to wait till 12/20 until Crucial would take action.  I was not expecting the order processing and deliver to take so long.. Order number is 1051302754739..

Shipping sucks.  They use the UPS sure post where the post office does final delivery.  UPS delivered to point of transfer to post office fairly quickly then several days no update of tracking.  Finally on about the 8th day it showed out for delivery.

Review.Titre: All I wanted after seeing no shipping…
Review.Contenu: All I wanted after seeing no shipping history, was an answer as to whether my product actually had shipped.  I called you and of course got customer service somewhere overseas.  I could not get any type of answer from them.  AND I hate when customer service just repeats back to me the facts that I gave them.  internet customer service… makes you want to go back and shop at K Mart.

Your shipping method (UPS Mail Innovations) is the slowest possible out there, taking a week+ for my item to get to me. Plus, your support department employs hard-to-understand people, who do not give proper information on how to resolve issues.

Review.Titre: Tracking the order in the beginning was…
Review.Contenu: Tracking the order in the beginning was hard to do. I tried to chat in multiple times and the chat screen just loaded it and over. It would be nice if you had a way that the client could go in and just get an update with what is going on.

Zero communication and slowest delivery possible.  I ordered on Dec 26, received on Jan 17, there was no communication about delays, no response to my inquiries about the status staying on “ordered” for weeks.  Product itself is fine.

After an 8 day wait to receive the memory I ordered. Your sub-contractor sent the wrong part number of that memory purchased and for the privilege of your mistake I had to pay additional shipping costs to return the memory to them. I Lost work time in the process and still have to wait until they SAY they have received the returned memory and then maybe have wait an additional 8 days to have my account credited. Very bad buying experience.

The products themselves are fine.  I have ordered before and never had trouble with the hardware.  However, you need to ditch Acronis TrueImage.  It is crap.  It is SLOOOOOW and doesn't work.  Had to switch to Macrium to get my disk cloned.

Review.Titre: poor service on weekends and after hours
Review.Contenu: if you order over a weekend and need to make any changes, things don't go as planned.at least not for me, they cancelled my order and made me re-order everything, delaying the order.All I wanted to do was cancel an nvme and replace it with a sata III drive.

Review.Titre: 16mb ram chip was really two 8mb Chips
Review.Contenu: Item described as 16mb ram chip was actually 2 8mb ram chips.  it makes a difference when ram slots are limited.  Also the return of product does not involve getting a shipping label.  Amazon has make return labels a shipping standard.

Review.Titre: The screw provided for securing the ssd…
Review.Contenu: The screw provided for securing the ssd is slightly too small, came loose after 48 hours and risked shorting out the motherboard.

Review.Titre: I ordered some RAM for my laptop…
Review.Contenu: I ordered some RAM for my laptop computer on 02/20/23. As of 03/08/23 I have not received my order.  I did receive an email on 02/22/23 saying that they do not currently have sufficient inventory to fill my order and that typically, inventory is replenished within seven to ten business days, but that that was just an estimate.  The company should adjust their system to let people know whether items are in stock or not so they don't create false expectations that goods will arrive on time.

The tracking information is not accurate and I am waiting since December 10 and still no item I have ordered. The thing is I am disappointed because I have used crucial in the past and things were fast and no issues

Review.Titre: It wasn't until 14 days after my…
Review.Contenu: It wasn't until 14 days after my account was debited that my purchase finally arrived. I had hoped that buying directly from the manufacturer that their "Free Shipping" wouldn't entail a two week delay in delivery.

The purchasing process was sinple. Easy to use, easy to find the right product. Especially since they have the product finder tool. However, after only 24 hrs of having my new NVME M.2 SSD my computer crashed. After performing numerous tests, the short and long DST results were not good. Tests determined that the SSD is on its last leg. Moments before the crash a test of read/write speed was performed and it peaked at a disturbing 1,400mbps which is very. Very. Far from it's claim to over 6,000.  The warranty process has not be bad so far, however I am still fresh into the claim and have not received the replacement drive. At this time one additional star given for the fairly simple warranty claim.

I'm giving two stars because the customer service rep was very helpful. Unfortunately the ssd did not clone and could not get it to clone on three attempts.   The computer is at a shop for cloning and it failed for them twice...so far.  May end up asking for a return.

Review.Titre: The shipping method you used is…
Review.Contenu: The shipping method you used is extremely risky. I have had several orders disappear from other companies that utilize the UPS "mail innovations" method.  From my experience, once UPS turns the item over to the US Postal Service for final destination delivery, there is an extremely good chance the item will mysteriously disappear.  That has happened to me several times.  Indeed this time the official USPS record shows that they delivered your shipment was delivered in my mailbox in the early afternoon, when in fact it did not show up on my front porch instead of mailbox until 8:30 pm that day. I do not know if it was a Postal Service employee who put it on my porch or a neighbor who received it by mistake.  Nevertheless, I feel lucky that it did arrive at all. Please consider any other shipping method other than UPS Mail Innovations.

I ordered 2x 16gb RAM and it took many days for the order to be filled and even longer plus the shipping time. Compounded by a snowstorm in colorado the delivery was further delayed by 2 additional days. (2 weeks since order.) I ordered RAM from corsair and the order was filled and got delivered in 4 days since purchase. I felt like i was let down by the shipping time and the time it took to fulfill an order from Micron. While the chips arrived in excellent condition i felt like it was lucky that they did because they were NOT boxed and the USPS delivery had folded the padded envelope. To make matters worse the RAM did not arrive in a static/moisture protective barrier like the RAM i ordered from Corsair did. At all most every turn i feel let down my Micron. From order fulfillment time, shipping time/speed, shipping material method, and no environmental protection for the RAM chips to protect against elements/static electricity.

Review.Titre: I used your on-line assessment tool for…
Review.Contenu: I used your on-line assessment tool for two different computers.  For both it said there were two RAM slots each that could hold  16 GB chips but only had 4GB in one.  So I ordered recommended 16 chips to replace the 4.  Turns out those 4 were integrated and not replaceable.   So now I have 2- 16 GB chips with no place to for them.

I ordered memory from Crucial on the 19/08. It finally arrived today 02/09. In between it was "lost" for a week somewhere between Germany and Netherlands. Crucials help desk advised that there was nothing they could do as they delivered in 10 working days and to wait until 04/09. Thats 16 days in real money.On the first fitting of the memory the computer would not boot. There was no display and the power button kept going off. I did try various combinations of old and new memory for the same result.Some research said to leave it for a while (32Gb @ 5-10 minutes). I retried this and my computer is now reporting 32Gb. So how is the memory? Well, its memory and I wouldnt know if its better or worse than other brands.Where things fall down is the delivery times. I could have bought the same from Amazon or eBuyer at the same or lower cost and had next day delivery.If anything does go wrong, I am expected to pay return postage and insurance, and accept all liability. Given the hassle of getting it in the first place I have zero faith in Crucial or their logistics if I need to return it.I hope there are no more problems.

Review.Titre: Can’t say how good or bad the product…
Review.Contenu: Can’t say how good or bad the product is yet but I will take a chance with a 5 yr warranty but it took forrreeevveerrr to get it over a week and no tracking for 4 days after they sent the email it was shipped

Review.Titre: Web site PC scan was inaccurate on…

Review.Titre: Had to pay taxes at the door!
Review.Contenu: Had to pay taxes at the door!The point missed by Crucial is to provide a BETER service by including all taxes and costs in the price and paying it on behalf of the customer. This is what a good business does. Product is great just this service is not!

I have tried cloning my existing drive 5 times to the new drive.  On the 3rd attempt, I was able to boot the computer with the new drive, however, something was corrupt and the Windows search would not work.  All other clones would not boot.  I ran SFC, and DISM no errors were found on the existing drive.  Some online posts say Acronis could be the problem.  I have a new drive that I cant use.

I was lucky to get the package at all as it even showed up after the date I was told after my third conversation.
I bought an item supposedly in stock only to receive a notice, a few days later, that it's back-ordered with no clear restocking date.

I paid more, knowingly, on your site rather than buying it from Amazon I was trying to keep money out of the machine that is AMAZON. I took the money I saved from a discount code and applied it to faster shipping. It took longer to arrive than it would've from Amazon and ended up costing me more in the end. Lesson learned.

Review.Titre: Still a good company but there is significant room to improve
Review.Contenu: I have a Dell Inspiron 13 (7386). I needed to upgrade my M.2 SSD. I looked everywhere to find info about what was compatible. The crucial scanner failed. The Kingston scanner said it could not identify the computer. I used the crucial database which stated I could upgrade my 256Gb M.2 SSD all the way up to a 4TB. Come to find out crucial's database was not correct. After i stalling, I received an error code I entered into Dell's website in qhich they let me know that either the drive was not compatible or was faulty. Then they offered compatible drives, which was only up to 1TB. I went to Best Buy, bought, installed and it worked fine. So I got to pay return shipping since the Crucial scanner didn't work on my computer and they don't stand by what their database says. Also they wanted me to write the RMA number on the form with the return address. Well they don't have anything that states it is the RMA. They sent two emails. One when opening the return and the other after the return was approved. They provided a return reference number, but they were different on each email. I had to call and ask. Then, the next day, they sent an email clearly stating which number was the RMA#. It is the return reference number on the 2nd email.

The website was lacking in several departments. From a bug that caused me to reset my browser data, to inadequate customer support, to inaccurate information from the compatibility test… it is safe to say that I did not have a pleasant experience shopping from Crucial, and will not be taking my future business here again without proper justification.Which is disappointing because the products are of an excellent quality, if only the user face was as well developed.
Item showed in stock, but took 3 weeks to ship with no notification of why.  Once it shipped, took 7 days to arrive.  Never again.

As others have said, the product is great and the pricing is good but delivery lead times are abysmal. Don't order if you need things asap!
Long shipping time. Below average communication. Pain to track order. Cheap shipping envelope with no padding. Ram seems to work fine.

I placed my order on 12/22.  I chose expedited shipping because my HDD is failing and didn't want to take a chance on complete failure before the new drive arrived.  while placing the order, there were no banners, popups, or any other indication that there would be a delay in shipping.  Fast Forward to a few chats, I learn that shipping was CLOSED from the 23rd until the 27th. That's fine, I would have had to hunt to find that information out but whatever.... Then, still nothing and find out that my item wasn't even in stock!!  so, AGAIN, nothing in the process that indicated or announced or even flagged that there was a stock issue.  so here we are, 9 BUSINESS days later and my order FINALLY ships. It is suppose to arrive tomorrow but literally 2 weeks from placing an express delivery order.  Sure, I was offered credits on my purchase yada yada, but the entire process was not even close to being good.FYI, The first person who apologised and said it would ship soon, DIDN'T tell me it was out of stock.  I found that out 4 days later in an email.

Review.Titre: Love the product, shipping is a mess
Review.Contenu: Love the product, hate the shipping. Every time I order from Crucial, I wind up having to chase down the package all over town because of Crucial's insistence on using 'last mile' shipping hand-off, which always winds up being mis-directed, or sent back to Crucial as undeliverable. Either pick one, or let the buyer choose what is best for them.  What Crucial is doing currently is a colossal pain.

I've purchased several memory modules from Crucial over the years and all have been delivered within a couple of days. Most recently, I ordered an external SSD. The product itself is good, but the delivery was painful. Almost immediately after ordering, I received a Royal Mail tracking code, telling me that my parcel was on its way. This turned out to be next to useless as the product was actually shipped from the EU and couldn't realistically be tracked until it got to the UK. In all, the delivery took 9 days which, in today's competitive marketplace, is far too slow - even if it was 'free'. Crucial needs to really up its game on this front or it will lose out to Amazon et al.

Good product.  Poor shipping.  Package was sent by carrier that said item would arrive on Tuesday.  Tuesday evening carrier site updated and said package to be delivered on Wednesday.  This was repeated on Thursday.  Package finally arrived on Friday.

Quality products. Prices when on sale are competitive with the big online sellers such as NewEgg.  Shipping takes a long time and I absolutely hate UPS Mail Innovations, tracking is practically not available until the Post Office receives the package on the day of delivery.  Use USPS Priority mail, much faster and reliable and not that expensive for large accounts.

Great product ordered 8GB DDR4-2400 UDIMM 1.2V CL17 memory upgrade for wife's computer, would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for the very slow processing & shipping. Ordered on 12/4 (am) wasn't processed and shipped till 12/7 (pm) started via UPS however got switched to USPS item received 12/13 (pm)....only shipped in large envelope with no packing

Review.Titre: I had a very difficult time completing…
Review.Contenu: I had a very difficult time completing the purchase. I found that the only system that could work to complete the purchase was a windows machine with the edge browser. I use other OS's and browsers, that makes purchases extremely difficult.

Review.Titre: Crucial gear is great, shipping horrible
Review.Contenu: Crucial gear is great. But the shipping dept is horrendous. Made my order Nov. 26th. Didnt get a tracking number for 5 days after order. Finally received my order Dec 9th. 2 sticks of 16gigs of ram. Envelope size package. I'm in central Oklahoma. My order shipped from Salt Lake City, went to Idaho, back to Salt Lake City, to somewhere in Texas, to Tulsa, a few small towns in-between then finally made it to my mailbox. Should really look at different shipping options.

Review.Titre: We have problems with our US Post…
Review.Contenu: We have problems with our US Post Office sending items back, loosing them, etc. When I ordered my last package from Crucial, it was assigned a UPS tracking number. All good until UPS handed it off to the USPS in Arizona. My stress went through the roof. My package was stamped with my PO Box number and a bright red stamp reading, UNABLE TO DELIVER TO STREET ADDRESS. Just a suggestion for you: please allow us to enter PO Boxes on your shipping to address form, maybe as an alternate or backup address. You say you don't deliver to PO Boxes, yet that's what happens after it left your facility. This also happens with Amazon orders, so it's not just happening with your orders. I was very lucky to have received my order this time. Thank you and yes, I love my ram upgrade and the X6. - Todd
Memory Works, does not run at rated speedShipping was super slow, was ordered before thanksgivingCustomer service sluggish over email

Review.Titre: When I first attempted to track my order could not be found.
Review.Contenu: When I first attempted to track my order, I received a message that my order could not be found. On the shipper's website, I was sent around in circles trying to find information about my order. I finally contacted Crucial's customer support, and I was told that Crucial would make good on my order, which made me fell at ease. I finally received my order a week later than promised.
Over charging sales tax by 4% and the lead time prior to shipping seemed longer than purchases in the past.

Review.Titre: I had an issue because the tracking…
Review.Contenu: I had an issue because the tracking link that was sent never worked.  I had a couple of chats, but no one could tell me if my package was delivered or how it was shipped.  I finally checked my mailbox, which I don't check often and the package was there.  So, if the package was shipped via USPS, the don't tell me it was UPS.

Review.Titre: Excellent product, Tech support needs support.
Review.Contenu: I did like that you have a knowledgeable sales department. I am not satisfied with the response from the level/tier 2 tech support though. I do understand the need to outsource tech support to India but I don't like it.

The product was fine, the delivery was fine, but the "seller" on PayPal bore no relation to the Crucial company, and I had for a while no idea who or why the payment was made to a company called "Digital River"... really, you can't make it obvious?

1. The web site promised me a discount for using the automatic system scanner. However, the scanner failed to run so I didn't get my discount. I have tried this scanner several times over the past couple of years, and I have never gotten it to work.2. I received a shipping confirmation on 11/3/2023. However, the package wasn't actually given to the shipper for at least another 4 days.

Review.Titre: You didn't have the product in stock…

Super slow shipping. I could have ordered it from Amazon for a few dollars more and had it in 2 days. Not 2 weeks!!
